content: r08 under one of the wings use a simple running stitch over one of the treble crochets just under the top loops taking the yarn back down to the centre repeat for the other wing secure the tail eyes start by passing black or chosen eye colour yarn through the body 3 times so that you can pull it tight to create indentations for the eyes bring the needle out 2 stitches in from a wing between r07/r08 create the first line by going back in directly above this through a stitch between r05/r06 bring the needle out where you want to make the other eye again between r07/r08 2 stitches in from the other wing go back in directly above this in r05/r06 pull these first two stitches tight to not only create little indentations for the eyes but also a slight bump between them for the beak to sit a little more proudly on now go over the indentations more loosely 2-3 times with black yarn secure your tails mfadreileenindes & p5/8 madeleine & friends pattern beak if using chunky yarns there is a slight adjustment the beak is worked as surface crochet if you struggle to get the hook between the stitches of the body then drop 0 5mm or 1mm in hook size attach orange or chosen beak yarn 1 stitch in from the right eye between r07/08 chicken s right your left as you re looking at it this is between 1 and 2 in the image below continue working towards the left eye picot 3 ch1 for chunky yarns ch1 picot 2 ch1 sk1 this is between 2 and 3 in the image below 1sc on the next stitch this is between 3 and 4 in the image below cut and pull through leaving enough tail for securing use a needle to take the tail down into the gap on the right of the stitch you just crocheted into so that both sides of the beak are 1 stitch in from the eyes this is 4 in the image below secure the tails mfadreileenindes & p6/8 madeleine & friends pattern wattle take red or chosen comb and wattle yarn down from between r03/ro4 in the centre of the head stitch 09 of r03 and come out between r07/r08 just off centre of and under the beak this is 2 in the image above sew a small line over the stitch you skipped when creating the beak this is the stitch between 2 and 3 in the image above sew over this several times until it forms a little bump on the final stitch for the wattle take the tail down to the base for securing the other end later now take your crochet hook back up to r03/r04 comb surface crochet to attach the working yarn over r03 push your hook down into r03/r04 and come back out directly above in r02/r03 pull a loop up and ch1 picot 3 surface crochet 1sc on
